channel.title: Science : NPR
channel.description: The latest health and science news. Updates on medicine, healthy living, nutrition, drugs, diet, and advances in science and technology. Subscribe to the Health & Science podcast.

item.title: To Infinity And Beyond: Celebrating 40 Years Of The Voyager Mission
item.description: August 23, 2017 - The Farthest: Voyager In Space, airing Wednesday on PBS, celebrates a technological and intellectual achievement rarely matched in history — one that has forever changed us, says Marcelo Gleiser.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 23, 2017 - The Farthest: Voyager In Space, airing Wednesday on PBS, celebrates a technological and intellectual achievement rarely matched in history — one that has forever changed us, says Marcelo Gleiser. http://www.npr.org/sections/13.7/2017/08/23/545484098/to-infinity-and-beyond-celebrating-40-years-of-the-voyager-mission

item.title: Los Angeles Tests Whether Lighter Color Streets Will Lower The Temperature
item.description: August 23, 2017 - Los Angeles is piloting a project called "Cool Pavement." The city is putting a light grey coating on top of some neighborhood streets in an effort to lower the air temperature.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 23, 2017 - Los Angeles is piloting a project called "Cool Pavement." The city is putting a light grey coating on top of some neighborhood streets in an effort to lower the air temperature. http://www.npr.org/2017/08/23/545435062/los-angeles-tests-whether-lighter-color-streets-will-lower-the-temperature

item.title: The Battle Over Oil And Gas Development In Colorado
item.description: August 23, 2017 - A deadly home explosion in Colorado is renewing fights over how close oil and gas development should be to expanding suburbs. One town is trying to figure out for itself how close is too close.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 23, 2017 - A deadly home explosion in Colorado is renewing fights over how close oil and gas development should be to expanding suburbs. One town is trying to figure out for itself how close is too close. http://www.npr.org/2017/08/23/545435045/the-battle-over-oil-and-gas-development-in-colorado

item.title: Dakota Access Pipeline Owner Sues Greenpeace For 'Criminal Activity'
item.description: August 22, 2017 - Energy Transfer Partners alleges Greenpeace and other "eco-terrorist groups" tried to block its pipeline with "campaigns of misinformation." Greenpeace says the suit is a bid to "silence free speech."
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 22, 2017 - Energy Transfer Partners alleges Greenpeace and other "eco-terrorist groups" tried to block its pipeline with "campaigns of misinformation." Greenpeace says the suit is a bid to "silence free speech." http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/08/22/545310247/dakota-access-pipeline-owner-sues-greenpeace-for-criminal-activity

item.title: Scientists Hope To Farm The Biofuel Of The Future In The Pacific Ocean
item.description: August 22, 2017 - International research labs are using seaweed to make biofuel, but little progress has been made in the U.S. Now scientists in California are developing a prototype to enable vast open-ocean farming.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 22, 2017 - International research labs are using seaweed to make biofuel, but little progress has been made in the U.S. Now scientists in California are developing a prototype to enable vast open-ocean farming. http://www.npr.org/sections/thesalt/2017/08/22/542903378/scientists-hope-to-farm-the-biofuel-of-the-future-in-the-pacific-ocean

item.title: In Alaska, One Man Fights To Save Oil Fund As Reserves Dry Up
item.description: August 22, 2017 - For 40 years, Alaska has been putting its oil money into a giant savings account. But now the oil — and the money — are drying up.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 22, 2017 - For 40 years, Alaska has been putting its oil money into a giant savings account. But now the oil — and the money — are drying up. http://www.npr.org/2017/08/22/545314118/in-alaska-one-man-fights-to-save-oil-fund-as-reserves-dry-up

item.title: California's Forests Continue To Die After Years Of Drought
item.description: August 22, 2017 - California's record drought is officially over. But trees are still dying across the state because they were so badly weakened by years without water.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 22, 2017 - California's record drought is officially over. But trees are still dying across the state because they were so badly weakened by years without water. http://www.npr.org/2017/08/22/545314063/californias-forests-continue-to-die-after-years-of-drought

item.title: American Science And The Nazis
item.description: August 22, 2017 - By standing strong against the Nazis, America became a beacon of hope to some of the world's greatest scientists — whose positive effects on American science we still feel today, says Adam Frank.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 22, 2017 - By standing strong against the Nazis, America became a beacon of hope to some of the world's greatest scientists — whose positive effects on American science we still feel today, says Adam Frank. http://www.npr.org/sections/13.7/2017/08/22/545253708/american-science-and-the-nazis

item.title: 'Smart' Pill Bottles Aren't Always Enough To Help The Medicine Go Down
item.description: August 22, 2017 - Lots of people forget to take their medicine on time. Now firms are selling "smart" pill bottles that send patients reminders through the Internet. But maybe the real problem isn't forgetfulness.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 22, 2017 - Lots of people forget to take their medicine on time. Now firms are selling "smart" pill bottles that send patients reminders through the Internet. But maybe the real problem isn't forgetfulness. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/08/22/538153337/smart-pill-bottles-arent-enough-to-help-the-medicine-go-down

item.title: Hospitals Could Do More For Survivors Of Opioid Overdoses, Study Suggests
item.description: August 22, 2017 - Researchers say hospitals are missing an opportunity to help people with opioid addiction get into treatment by not doing enough when they show up in emergency rooms after an overdose.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 22, 2017 - Researchers say hospitals are missing an opportunity to help people with opioid addiction get into treatment by not doing enough when they show up in emergency rooms after an overdose. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/08/22/545115225/hospitals-could-do-more-for-survivors-of-opioid-overdoses-study-suggests

item.title: The Sugar Story: A Spoonful Of Addiction Makes The Profits Go Up?
item.description:
August 22, 2017 - Americans are facing down a decades-long sugar habit.
- http://the1a.org/shows/2017-08-22/the-sugar-story-a-spoonful-of-addiction-makes-the-profits-go-up

item.title: How To Tell If Watching The Eclipse Damaged Your Eyes
item.description: August 21, 2017 - If you heeded all the warnings, you're likely fine. But spots or blurred vision that shows up 12 hours later or the next day might be a sign that the sun's direct rays permanently hurt the retina.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 21, 2017 - If you heeded all the warnings, you're likely fine. But spots or blurred vision that shows up 12 hours later or the next day might be a sign that the sun's direct rays permanently hurt the retina. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/08/21/545129631/how-to-tell-if-you-ve-damaged-your-eyes-watching-the-eclipse

item.title: PHOTOS: The Day The Eclipse Came To America
item.description:
August 21, 2017 - A total solar eclipse crossed the entire country earlier today. Many Americans were treated to a rare and stunning view.
- http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/08/21/545083434/photos-the-day-the-eclipse-came-to-america
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)

item.title: Total Solar Eclipse Travels From Oregon To South Carolina
item.description: August 21, 2017 - From coast to coast, a total solar eclipse crossed the United States on Monday. Fourteen states were in the path of total darkness, while a partial eclipse was visible in other parts of the country.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 21, 2017 - From coast to coast, a total solar eclipse crossed the United States on Monday. Fourteen states were in the path of total darkness, while a partial eclipse was visible in other parts of the country. http://www.npr.org/2017/08/21/545071440/total-solar-eclipse-travels-from-oregon-to-south-carolina

item.title: Americans View Astronomical Show As Total Solar Eclipse Sweeps Across U.S.
item.description: August 21, 2017 - The total solar eclipse swept across the country on Monday from Oregon to South Carolina. A partial eclipse was also visible in other parts of the U.S. All Things Considered checked in with some listeners who witnessed the eclipse.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 21, 2017 - The total solar eclipse swept across the country on Monday from Oregon to South Carolina. A partial eclipse was also visible in other parts of the U.S. All Things Considered checked in with some listeners who witnessed the eclipse. http://www.npr.org/2017/08/21/545071403/americans-view-astronomical-show-as-total-solar-eclipse-sweeps-across-u-s
